comment: Bhandari's lectures are FANTASTIC, but her lab teaching style is different. Her lab lectures are quite broad, so you definitely need to learn more from the lab manual. Then again, we did have to do lab 100% online for summer, so that might be a cause. Summer online had Mastering, 3 D2L quizzes, 3 Practicals. I do not regret picking her! LOVED IT
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Bhandari is one of the best professors you can get! Lectures are straight to the point and not boring/long-winded. No surprise content on tests; study the ppts well! She is extremely understanding for us college students. Sadly, she's heading off to med school and won't be teaching anymore. I would choose her for every class if I could!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is very straight forward with what will be on the practicals. I recommend taking her. She doesn't waste your time at all.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: Not very personable but she was a good lab professor. If you follow her instructions and study well for the practicals it'll be fine. Not a lot of work outside lab at all besides studying and was very nice about COVID shutdowns and such. She is very straight and to the point.

Shivani was a great professor. She really enjoyed teaching the material. She had 5 tests and a final. all 6 were very straight forward and easy if you studied for them. There was also homework but it was an easy A. Overall a pretty good class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Professor Bhandari is a great professor. Her lectures are informative and interesting. Her test questions come straight from the powerpoint! Write everything down and STUDY! You won't pass if you don't study. She gives out mastering homework for completion. Overall she is a wonderful professor who will work with you if you have problems.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Took her for A and P 1 Lab and got an A. There are 3 tests. You have to study for them or you won't pass the class. Attendance is mandatory and gives points if you show up. Hard class but manageable if you put in the time to study.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Caring

comment: Professor Bhandari is a good professor. In lab we had 3 exams and effort points which meant you just had to show up. Her lab exams are not hard if you paid attention and studied. This class requires a lot of studying and memorization so be prepared.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This class consisted of 3 tests, attendance, and effort (basically showing up). You have to understand lecture beforehand because she just gives a quick overview, then the rest of the class you spend your own time looking at models and basically studying. She is there to answer questions and help out. The tests were very fair.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Professor Bhandari was an amazing professor. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but in class she will tell you exactly what will be on the test and how she will format it. She's young and understands what being a college student is like, so shes there to help. Hard course made simple- tests are not too hard- no trick questions, only what she taught you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Willing to answer questions in class but doesn't really teach the material, just tells us what we're supposed to work on. Gives a big study guide for the effort grade that's really helpful, and gives big extra credit opportunities that relate to making study materials. Really cool to talk to once you break through her professor shell.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is very knowledgeable about the course and cares about how well you in class. Although she can be a little unapproachable at times, once you do, she is very helpful. The course included five tests and mastering homework graded for completion. It is pretty easy to get a high grade because she tells you everything you need.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She breaks down the textbook information so that it is understandable. She will draw diagrams in class to break down the textbook diagrams and will go over specifics that we need to focus on for her exams. She has lots of exams and homework so theres plenty of opportunities to perform well. If you skip class you will miss specific information.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: this class had a rocky start but she really got into it and turned everything around. her tests are fair and she is really approachable is you need to talk about something. though she did not take attendance her lectures were very relevant and engaging (went to every class 8 am class and didn't fall asleep). would take her again if i could!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Shivani is a really great professor! She's very knowledgeable and gives you lots of resources including powerpoints with her notes and learning objectives. Definitely go to class and take notes on the powerpoint and study the learning objectives. The tests are hard so you have to work but its a very passable class! She offers generous extra credit!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I really liked her for A&P2. She made the information very manageable and it was pretty easy to do well on her tests. Obviously its a tough class, but if you study you should have no problem doing well! I also had her for A&P 2 Lab and she was great.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She's knowledgeable on the subject of human anatomy but she isn't really clear on what she expects us to know. She's a little rude with the class at times, and the tests were harder and different than what she said to expect. I'd only take her if you know you'd do good in anatomy or already took the lecture.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Bhandari is a pretty good professor. For A&P 1 I'd mainly study by reading the book, but for this class I didn't really have to at all. Just listen to her lectures (or record them), read her powerpoints, do her objectives/study guide, and take notes and you'll pass. If you need help she'll gladly go over anything with you in her office
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: If you listen to what she says in class, you will pass! There are no surprises AND she gives extra points! HIghly recommend her for AP2! it's a lot of information but she makes it do able.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Wow, I love her. She tells you everything that will be on the exams. Her exams are straight forward from her PP. you need to go to class though to get the correct notes from her lectures. She really knows her stuff. Its a lot to know, but if you do the objectives and put the time in you will easily pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I really liked her because she clearly laid out what to expect and as long as you do those things you will pass. She will tell you exact things that will be on your practicals so be there for each lab. Labs usually never last the entire class time you kinda go at your own pace. Show up to get the attendance effort points.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria
